Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the emails were "never reviewed" until after the 2016 election, when in fact they were reviewed days before the election.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only relies on a misinterpretation of an FBI document and ignores widely reported facts.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the FBI intentionally waited until after the election to review the emails, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the emails were reviewed before the election, as indicated by the June 2018 report from the Justice Department Office of the Inspector General.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the emails were reviewed days before the election, as stated in the expert's verdict.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misinterpreting the FBI document and ignoring widely reported facts.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
